ABV: 8.8 % by volume
IBU: 35 IBU
SRM: 5
Efficiency: 75%
directions:
Directions:
The original brewing record is rather concise. It is “an instruction to brew 16 barrels of good beer,” for which were used 12 vats of wheat, 36 vats of barley, and 6 vats of spelt or “short oats,” along with 40 pounds of hops. There’s no indication of what was malted and wasn’t, but from common practice at the time it can be concluded that the barley was malted and the wheat was not. At Villers abbey, some of the spelt was malted and some wasn’t. I tried to make the best sense of the quantities indicated, and the result is actually comparable in gravity to that of today’s Tripel Karmeliet. My version is also a bit flattered in the sense of efficiency: probably at the time efficiency was lower and attenuation often wouldn’t go much higher than 50%. Feel free to make adjustments to better approximate the 17th-century original.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the January/February 2020 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Belgian dark strong ale
The Mead Mamas, a female meadmaking group, are part of Michigan's CRAFT homebrew club and have been making mead since 2008. Our goal is to make the best mead possible and further the mead community.
This braggot recipe--an ancient historically associated with medieval Britain--showcases the marriage of beer and mead. In this case, the recipe uses a Belgian dark strong ale base combined with enough honey to showcase the qualities both the beer and mead qualities.
The Mead Mamas even took it a step further and served this recipe as a braggot slushy during the Michigan Homebrew Festival. To recreate the slushies, blend this beer with peach mead (the Mead Mamas used a mead in the 12-14% ABV range) at a beer-to-mead ratio of 1:2 and run the resulting mixture through a slushy machine.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS & ADJUNCTS
12 lb. (5.44 kg) Dingemans Pilsner malt
2 lb. (907 g) Dingemans CaraMunich malt
1 lb. (454 g) torrified wheat
3 lb. (1.36 kg) Candi Syrup D-180
HOPS
1.5 oz. (42 g) Hallertauer Mittelfrüh, 5% a.a. @ 60 min
1.5 oz. (42 g) Styrian Goldings, 5% a.a. @ 15 min
YEAST
Imperial Yeast B63 Monastic
ADDITIONAL ITEMS
1 Whirlfloc Tablet, Boil 5.0 min
Specifications:
Yield: 5 US gal. (22.9 L)
Original Gravity: 1.096 (11.4°P)
Final Gravity: 1.022 (5.6°P)
ABV: 10%
IBU: 30
SRM: 36
Efficiency: 70%
directions:
Directions:
Mash 60 minutes at 148°F (64°C). Lauter, sparge, and collect wort. Boil 60 minutes, adding Candi Syrup at flameout. Chill to 63°F (17°C), oxygenate for 90 seconds, and pitch yeast. Ramp temperature to 73°F (23°C) over 7 days. When specific gravity falls to 1.014 (3.6°P), rack, drop to 60°F (16°C) for 10 days and then to 45°F (7°C) for 3 weeks.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the January/February 2016 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
This strong, dark wheat beer recipe is sure to warm up your toes and your taste buds on a crisp night!
All quantities and specifications in the recipe are based on a nominal system extract efficiency of only 55% and a target original gravity of 24°P (1.101 SG). Your homebrew setup may perform better or worse with this substantial grain bill, so adjust quantities as needed for your expected efficiency.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
9.28 lb. (4.21 kg) Weyermann® Barke® Pilsner Malt (46.5%)
5.39 lb. (2.44 kg) Weyermann® Pale Wheat Malt (27%)
3.0 lb. (1.36 kg) Weyermann® Dark Wheat Malt (15%)
1.5 lb. (680 g) Weyermann® Carawheat® Malt (7.5%)
0.6 lb. (272 g) Weyermann® Acidulated Malt (3%)
0.2 lb. (90 g) Weyermann® Roasted Chocolate Wheat Malt (1%)
1.6 lb. (723 g) rice hulls
HOPS
0.5 oz. (14 g) Herkules, 14.5% a.a., 60 min
0.3 oz. (7 g) Saphir, 3.25% a.a., 10 min
0.8 oz. (21 g) Saphir, 3.25% a.a., 5 min
YEAST
Fermentis WB-06 or Fermentis Safbrew Abbaye
Specifications:
Yield: 5 US gallons (19 L)
Original Gravity: 1.101
Final Gravity: 1.018-1.020
ABV: 10.20%
IBU: 35
SRM: 20
directions:
Directions:
Dough in at approximately 113°F (45°C) for a 30-minute hydration and beta-glucanase rest. To mitigate subsequent lautering problems, it is also advisable to add about 10% of the dry malt weight in rice hulls at dough-in. After the cytolytic rest, infuse the mash with hot brewing liquor to raise the temperature to 122°F (50°C) for a proteolytic rest of 30 minutes at the peak-performance temperature of protease. Next, raise the mash to 149°F (65°C), the peak-performance temperature of beta amylase. This ensures the production of plenty of fermentables, and thus of alcohol. Allow 30 minutes for this diastatic rest. Repeat the temperature rise a final time to reach the alpha amylase peak temperature of 162°F (72°C). Rest the mash again, this time for 15 minutes, to convert the remaining starches into unfermentable dextrins for extra body in the finished beer. The large grain bill, in conjunction with the many hot-water infusions, is also likely to fill the mash tun to the limit of its capacity. Recirculate the wort thoroughly for perhaps 30 minutes. Then sparge and lauter simultaneously. Use the hot sparge liquor to raise the grain bed temperature to the mash-out temperature of 170°F (77°C). The run-off is likely to be slow! Stop sparging as soon as the kettle gravity is about 1.086 (20.8°P), assuming a 10% evaporation rate during a 90-minute kettle boil. In some mash tun configurations, because of aspect ratios and false-bottom designs, a kettle gravity of 1.086 may not be possible to achieve. In this case, simply sparge until the kettle is full. Then extend the boil until the net kettle gravity of 24°P is reached through evaporation. When weighing out the hop additions, adjust quantities to the projected actual net kettle volume. Boil for at least 90 minutes (or longer if the original gravity at the start of the boil is an issue). Add bittering hops 60 minutes before the anticipated shutdown time. Add flavor hops with 10 minutes of boil time remaining. Add aroma hops 5 minutes before shutdown. Whirlpool and chill. Pitch about twice as much yeast as you normally would for a “regular” brew and aerate well. In our experimental batch, we used 1.5 oz./5 gal. (44 g/19 L) of dried yeast. Primary ferment the brew at the middle of the preferred temperature range of the selected yeast for a total of 3 weeks. At the end of primary fermentation, rack the brew into a clean tank for 7–8 days of secondary fermentation. Prime and bottle the brew. Alternatively, rack the brew into a keg and let it mature for 2 weeks under pressure. Finally, adjust carbonation in the keg to 3.3 to 4.5 volumes (6.6 to 9 g/L) of CO2 before dispensing it unfiltered from the keg.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2017 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
A silver medal-winning imperial stout recipe from the 2017 National Homebrew Competition courtesy of brewers Ryan Golden and Matt Warren of Signal Mountain, TN. With help from their club Barley Mob Brewers and BeerSmith, they've created a intricate and delicious recipe sure to warm any cold winter hands.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
Fermentables
1 lb. (454 g) rice hulls
40 lb. (18.14 kg) Maris Otter (4°L)
5 lb. (2.27 kg) flaked wheat (2°L)
4 lb. (1.81 kg) pale chocolate malt (225°L)
3 lb. (1.36 kg) UK chocolate malt (515°L)
3 lb. (1.36 kg) roasted barley (695°L)
3 lb. (1.36 kg) Special B malt (152°L)
1 lb. (454 g) caramel/crystal 120°L malt (120°L)
Hops
5.5 oz. (165 g) Magnum, 12.3% a.a. @ 90 min
2 oz. (57 g) Fuggles, 4.2% a.a. @ 20 min
2 oz. (57 g) Styrian Goldings, 3.4% a.a. @ 20 min
2 oz. (57 g) Fuggles, 4.2% a.a., steep/whirlpool 15 min
2 oz. (57 g) Styrian Goldings, 3.4% a.a., steep/whirlpool 15 min
1 Whirlfloc Tablet @ 5 min
Yeast
Wyeast 1028 London Ale Yeast
Specifications:
Yield: 12 US gallons
Original Gravity: 1.124
Final Gravity: 1.03
directions:
Directions:
Mash in with 18.9 gal. (71.5 L) of 165°F (74°C) water and hold at a rest temperature of 153°F (67°C) for 60 min. Batch sparge by draining mash tun, adding 8.2 gal. (31 L) of 168°F (76°C) water, and then draining again. Boil 120 minutes, adding hops as indicated. Ferment at 65°F (18­°C) until terminal gravity is reached. When primary fermentation is complete, transfer to a bourbon barrel and age until the desired amount of oak and bourbon character is reached.

description:
Rusty Burrell’s Mango Maya Milkshake IPA won the annual Stone Homebrew Competition & AHA Rally in November 2018. The beer was a crowd favorite during the people’s-choice-style vote, and the Stone team recently replicated Rusty’s recipe at Stone World Bistro & Gardens – Liberty Station. The beer has been on tap in San Diego and Richmond, VA, for several weeks, but it won’t last long! It was also entered into the coveted Great American Beer Festival Pro-Am Competition in 2019.
“The recipe is inspired by a strawberry milkshake IPA that my fellow beer nerd brother-in-law shared with me from Tired Hands Brewing Co. I was blown away by it. Throughout the ensuing months, I drafted up several milkshake IPA recipes using different fruits such as strawberry, blueberry, and peach. My daughter Maya’s first birthday was approaching, and my brother-in-law was coming to town for the event; so I knew I had to nail a good milkshake IPA to showcase my skills for him and the rest of the family for the celebration. ‘Mango Maya’ was the result—mango milkshake IPA with coconut. It was a hit at the party, so I entered it into the Stone Homebrew Competition and won!
“The tropical mango and coconut combination paired with the vanilla and lactose makes for a tasty brew. The hops come through just enough to let you know they are there, but not as much as you’d expect for the amount of hops in the recipe. I’ve been able to serve this to many folks who’ve said they don’t prefer IPA, or even beer in general!”
ingredients:
Ingredients:
FERMENTABLES
9 lb. (4.08 kg) pale 2-row malt
2 lb. (907 g) oat malt
2 lb. (907 g) flaked oats
2 lb. (907 g) wheat malt
1 lb. (454 g) honey malt
1 lb. (454 g) lactose (milk sugar)
6 lb. (2.72 kg) mango (late addition)
HOPS
0.75 oz. (21 g) Warrior pellet hops @ 60 min
0.3 oz. (9 g) Warrior pellet hops @ 30 min
3 oz. (85 g) Citra pellet hops @ 0 min
3 oz. (85 g) Mosaic pellet hops @ 0 min
3 oz. (85 g) Citra pellet hops @ dry hop, 3 days
3 oz. (85 g) Mosaic pellet hops @ dry hop, 3 days
Additional Ingredients
Yeast: RVA 132 Manchester (or London Ale III equivalent)
1 vanilla bean in secondary
8 oz. (227 g) flaked coconut in secondary
Specifications:
Yield: 5 US gallons (18.9 L)
Original Gravity: 1.094
Final Gravity: 1.031
ABV: 8.30%
IBU: 49
SRM: 8
Efficiency: 70%
directions:
Directions:
Standard infusion mash at 152°F (66.7°C) for 60 minutes and batch sparge. Adjunct addition notes:
* Lactose can be added at flameout.
* For the mango, plan to add after high kräusen. I buy frozen mango chunks, thaw at room temperature, and then blend into puree.
* Vanilla bean should be prepared in a tincture: split and scrape the bean(s), add to a small glass, and top with very small amount of vodka (enough to cover the scraped bean and filling).
* Add the vanilla bean tincture and coconut with the dry hops: I usually put them all together in a muslin bag.
* Once fermentation is complete, cold crash for 24 hours and then package.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Russell Berger of Portland, OR, member of the Portland Brewers Collective, won a bronze medal in Category #2: Pale European Beer with a German Helles Exportbier during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Berger’s German Helles Exportbier was chosen as a top three entry among 394 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
3.85 lb Best Heidelberg Pilsner Malt
3.85 lb Weyermann Pilsner Malt
3.75 lb Great Western Pure Idaho Pilsen Malt
0.25 lb Weyermann Melanoidin Malt
0.65 lb Weyermann Munich I Malt
HOPS
1.75 oz. Tettnanger pellets, 4.4% AA, First Wort Hop
YEAST
Imperial Organic Yeast L17 Harvest, 1.5 M cells/mL/P
Additional Ingredients
BrewTan B in mash yeast nutrient in boil
Whirlfloc in boil
Specifications:
Yield: 6 US gal
Original Gravity: 1.054
Final Gravity: 1.01
ABV: 6.50%
IBU: 22
SRM: 5
Efficiency: 80%
directions:
Directions:
Dough in at 131° F with 1.5 qt/lb of pre-treated water (including sufficient lactic acid to bring mash pH to 5.2. I used 3.5 mL), rest for 15 minutes (I recirculate and regulate temperature with a HERMS system). Raise temperature to 148° F and rest 30 minutes. Raise temperature to 160° F and rest 30 minutes. Raise temperature to 168° F and rest 10 minutes. Fly sparge with 170° F water, with FWH addition in kettle as you run off. Boil 90 minutes, adding whirlfloc 15 minutes prior to knockout and yeast nutrient 10 minutes prior to knockout. Chill as cold as you can, as quickly as you can. Rack into a sanitized carboy, cover the neck with foil, and allow the cold break to settle. After 30 minutes or so, rack the clear wort off the trub into your fermenter. If it is not 50° F at this time, chill it to 50° F. Pitch yeast, then force pure oxygen into solution through a sintered stone for 2 minutes. The convection from the oxygen helps distribute the yeast into the beer. Allow the beer temperature to rise to 52° F and hold until gravity falls to ~1.030. Raise the beer temperature to 57° F and hold until gravity falls to ~1.016. Raise the beer temperature to 62° F and hold until fully attenuated and then start pulling samples and testing for VDK reduction. Once you get a negative VDK result, perform a closed transfer to a keg. Begin dropping the keg temperature a few degrees every 12 hours, with low CO2 pressure on the keg to prevent air ingress through the lid. Once the beer has reached 32 °F, fine with gelatin and lager for 4 weeks. Force carbonate to 2.7 volumes.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Kevin Lemme of Carmel, IN, won a bronze medal in Category #4: Amber European Beer with a Vienna Lager during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Lemme’s Vienna Lager was chosen as a top three entry among 365 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
8 lb. German Pilsner malt
8 lb. Vienna malt
2.5 lb. Dark Munich malt
2.5 lb. Weyermann Caraamber Malt
HOPS
7.5 oz. Northern Brewer, 60 min
3.5 oz. Czech Saaz, 20 min
YEAST
Imperial L17 (Harvest) yeast 4 packs placed into a 4 L starter three days prior to brew day on a stir plate
Additional Ingredients
Yeast nutrient, 15 min
Whirlfloc, 15 min
Specifications:
Yield: 10 US gal
Original Gravity: 1.05
Final Gravity: 1.012
ABV: 5.10%
IBU: 20
SRM: 10
Efficiency: 90%
directions:
Directions:
Mash at 125° F for 30 minutes, 147° F for 30 minutes, 162° F for 30 minutes. No mash out, recirculate until clear.  Collect 15 gallons.  Boil for 90 minutes total to eliminate DMS.  Add hops as described. Chill to 50° F. Oxygenate with pure oxygen for 3 minutes at 1 L/minute and pitch decanted starter. Using Tasty’s fermentation schedule as a guide, let free rise to 52° F and rest for 4-5 days.  Then raise to 58° F for 2-3 days; then raise to 62° F for 2-3 days.  Once terminal gravity is reached, slowly chill to 32° F by dropping the temperature 2-3° F per day.  Keg and lager for 3 months, but taste along the way because that’s just too long to wait.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Derek Springer of San Marcos, CA, member of the Society of Barley Engineers, won a bronze medal in Category #6: Strong European Lager with a Helles Bock during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Springer’s Helles Bock was chosen as a top three entry among 269 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS & ADJUNCTS
8.0 lb. (3.63 kg) Pilsner (Weyermann)
3.0 lb. (1.36 kg) Vienna Malt (Weyermann)
1.5 lb. (680 g) Munich II (Weyermann)
4.0 oz. (113 g) Biscuit (Dingemans)
4.0 oz. (113 g) Melanoidin (Weyermann)
HOPS
0.5 oz. (14 g) Sterling, 11.3% a.a. @ 60 min
0.5 oz. (14 g) Sterling, 11.3% a.a. @ 15 min
0.5 oz. (14 g) Sterling, 11.3% a.a. @ 5 min
YEAST
White Labs WLP830 German Lager
Specifications:
Yield: 5.5 US gal (20.8 L)
Original Gravity: 1.068
Final Gravity: 1.016
ABV: 7.40%
IBU: 32.4
SRM: 6.4
directions:
Directions:
Direct fire Hochkurz mash: 145ºF for 40 minutes. 158ºF for 20 minutes. Mash out at 168ºF for 10 minutes. Batch sparge, drain 100% then add sparge water at 180ºF, should even out at ~168ºF.  Use a 4 L stir plate starter, decanted before pitch. Oxygenate w/ pure O2 for 90 seconds. Pitch yeast at 48ºF, set regulator to 50ºF. Then follow this schedule: 2 days after pitch set regulator to 55ºF/12.5ºC 4 days after pitch set regulator to 60ºF/15.5ºC 6 days after pitch set regulator to 65ºF/18.5ºC 12 days after pitch set regulator to 32ºF/0ºC. 13 days after add gelatin 14 days after pitch transfer to keg and carb.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Paul Brown of Pinole, CA, member of the Diablo Order of Zymiracle Enthusiasts (DOZE), won a bronze medal in Category #7: German Wheat Beer with a Weissbier during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Brown’s Weissbier was chosen as a top three entry among 200 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS & ADJUNCTS
6.0 lb. (2.72 kg) Wheat Malt, Red (Rahr)
5.0 lb. (2.27 kg) Pilsner (Weyermann)
12.0 oz. (340 g) Melanoiden Malt
8.0 oz. (227 g) Acidulated (Weyermann)
HOPS
0.3 oz. (9 g) Magnum, 12.0% a.a., FWH
YEAST
White Labs WLP300 Hefeweizen Ale
ADDITIONAL ITEMS
0.2 oz. (6 g) Calcium Chloride, Mash 60 min
0.1 oz. (3 g) Gypsum (Calcium Sulfate), Mash 60 min
Yeast Nutrient
Specifications:
Yield: 5.5 US gal (20.8 L)
Original Gravity: 1.044
Final Gravity: 1.006
ABV: 6.50%
IBU: 9.8
SRM: 5
directions:
Directions:
Double infusion mash with a 30 minute rest at 122° F. Add 192° F water to mash to bring it to 148° F for 30 minutes. Bring temp to 168° F for mash out. Sparge with 168° F water.  Boil for 90 minutes, chill and ferment at 64° F for 5 days, then 66° F until fermentation is complete. Carbonate to 3.0 volumes of CO2. Serve fresh!

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Brian Phad of Lockport, IL, member of the PALE homebrew club, won a bronze medal in Category #8: Pale British Ale with a Strong Bitter during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Phad’s Strong Bitter was chosen as a top three entry among 243 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS & ADJUNCTS
11.0 lb. (4.99 kg) Pale Malt, Maris Otter
16.0 oz. (454 g) Caramel/Crystal Malt - 60L
8.0 oz. (227 g) Aromatic Malt
8.0 oz. (227 g) Victory Malt
4.5 oz. (127 g) Dark Crystal
4.0 oz. (113 g) Brown Sugar, Light
HOPS
1.0 oz. (28 g) Goldings, East Kent, 6.0% a.a., FWH
1.0 oz. (28 g) Goldings, East Kent, 6.0% a.a. @ 30 min
0.5 oz. (14 g) East Kent Goldings (EKG), 5.0% a.a. @ 15 min
0.5 oz. (14 g) Goldings, East Kent, 6.1% a.a., whirlpool/steep
YEAST
Wyeast Labs 1469 West Yorkshire Ale
ADDITIONAL ITEMS
0.3 oz. (10 g) Chalk, Mash 60 min
0.2 oz. (7 g) Baking Soda, Mash 60 min
0.1 oz. (2 g) Calcium Chloride, Mash 60 min
Epsom Salt (MgSO4), Mash 60 min
Specifications:
Yield: 6 US gal (22.7 L)
Original Gravity: 1.06
Final Gravity: 1.01
ABV: 5.90%
IBU: 34.9
SRM: 14
directions:
Directions:
BIAB, Single Infusion full volume mash at 152° F for 60 minutes. Add Brown Sugar in last 10 minutes of boil. After flameout, add whirlpool hops and whirlpool 20 minutes. Chill to 65° F and allow to rise to 68-70° F during ferment. Carbonate to 2.0 vol CO2.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Dennis Mitchell of Chandler, AZ, member of the 2019 NHC Homebrew Club, the Arizona Society of Homebrewers (ASH), won a bronze medal in Category #9: Scottish & Irish Ale with an Irish Red Ale during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Mitchell’s Irish Red Ale was chosen as a top three entry among 222 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
6.5 lb. Mild malt
3 lb. Vienna malt
1 lb. Crystal 40
1 lb. Flaked corn
0.25 lb. Roasted Barley
HOPS
0.7 oz. East Kent Goldings, 6% a.a. @ 60 min
0.5 oz. East Kent Goldings, 6% a.a. @ 30 min
0.25 oz. East Kent Goldings, 6% a.a. @ 10 min
YEAST
1 packet Imperial Yeast A10 Darkness
Specifications:
Yield: 5 US gallons
Original Gravity: 1.05
Final Gravity: 1.01
ABV: 4.80%
Efficiency: 70%
directions:
Directions:
Water Treatment: RO water with 1 tsp calcium chloride added to mash. Single infusion mash at 152°F for 60 minutes. No sparge batch, so all brewing liquor added to mash then drained. Chill to 68°F and pitch yeast. Ferment at 64°F.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Ben Gaylord of Denver, CO, won a bronze medal in Category #10: American Pale Ale during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Gaylord’s American Pale Ale was chosen as a top three entry among 312 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
10.5 lbs 2-Row malt
1.5 lbs Munich malt 10L
0.5 lbs Cara-Pils malt
0.25 lbs Crystal malt 60L
HOPS
0.5 oz Citra pellets, 12% AA, first wort hop
1.0 oz Citra pellets, 12% AA, 20 min
1.0 oz Citra pellets, 12% AA, 10 min
1.0 oz Citra pellets, 12% AA, 5 min
1.5 oz Citra pellets, 12% AA,whirlpool 15 min
3.0 oz Citra pellets, 12% AA, Dry hop 7 days
YEAST
White Labs WLP002 English Ale
Specifications:
Yield: 5.5 US gal
Original Gravity: 1.067
Final Gravity: 1.012
ABV: 5.70%
IBU: 77.4
SRM: 7
Efficiency: 71.50%
directions:
Directions:
Single infusion mash at 154° F for 60 minutes. Lauter then boil for 60 minutes. Add whirlpool hops, and allow 15 minutes of contact time. Chill to 68° F and pitch healthy yeast starter. Ferment at 68° F. On day 7, add dry hops and allow temperature to free rise to 72° F. Dry hop for 7 days. Force carbonate to 2.6 vol. CO2.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Derek Springer of San Marcos, CA, member of the Society of Barley Engineers, won a bronze medal in Category #11: Amber & Brown American Ale with an American Amber Ale during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Springer’s American Amber Ale was chosen as a top three entry among 281 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS & ADJUNCTS
4.0 lb. (1.81 kg) Brewer's Malt, 2-Row, Premium (Great Western)
4.0 lb. (1.81 kg) Maris Otter (Crisp)
16.0 oz. (454 g) Munich II (Weyermann)
8.0 oz. (227 g) Biscuit (Dingemans)
8.0 oz. (227 g) Crystal 120, 2-Row, (Great Western)
8.0 oz. (227 g) Crystal 40, 2-Row, (Great Western)
8.0 oz. (227 g) Crystal 75, 2-Row, (Great Western)
HOPS
1.0 oz. (28 g) Galaxy, 18.1% a.a. @ 15 min
1.0 oz. (28 g) Centennial, 10.4% a.a. @ 5 min
1.0 oz. (28 g) Motueka, 7.3% a.a. @ 5 min
1.0 oz. (28 g) Centennial, 10.4% a.a., dry hop 3 days
1.0 oz. (28 g) Galaxy, 18.1% a.a., dry hop 3 days
1.0 oz. (28 g) Motueka, 7.3% a.a., dry hop 3 days
YEAST
White Labs WLP090 San Diego Super Yeast
Specifications:
Yield: 5.5 US gal (20.8 L)
Original Gravity: 1.057
Final Gravity: 1.015
ABV: 5.60%
IBU: 180.9
SRM: 14.7
directions:
Directions:
Single infusion mash @ 153 ºF for 60 minutes. Direct fire heat to mash out at 168 ºF for 10 minutes. Batch sparge, drain 100% then add sparge water at 180 ºF, should even out ~168 ºF.  Use 1L stir plate starter, decanted before pitching. Oxygenate w/ 60 seconds of pure O2. Pitch yeast at and set regulator to 65 ºF. After 1 day, set regulator to 68 ºF. After 4 days add dry hops. After 7 days or so set regulator to 32 ºF. A day after that add gelatin and a day after that keg and carb.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Ross Druckenmiller of Revere, MA, member of the Boston Wort Processors, won a bronze medal in Category #12: Brown British Beer with a Dark Mild during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Druckenmiller’s Dark Mild was chosen as a top three entry among 259 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
6 lb Thomas Fawcett Golden Promise
12 oz Bairds crystal 70/80L
12 oz Crisp brown malt
8 oz flaked oats, toasted at 300F for 30 minutes
4 oz Breiss Midnight Wheat
4 oz Crisp Pale Chocolate
4 oz Weyermann Munich
1 2 oz Simpsons DRC
HOPS
1 oz UK East Kent Goldings Pellets, 4.7% a.a.a @ 60 min
YEAST
Wyeast 1335 British Ale 2
Additional Ingredients
1/2 tsp yeast nutrients, 10 min
1/2 whirlfloc tablet, 10 min
Specifications:
Yield: 5.25 US gal
Original Gravity: 1.039
Final Gravity: 1.013
ABV: 3.40%
IBU: 17.3
SRM: 23
Efficiency: 65%
directions:
Directions:
Mash in with 17.5 qts water for a 60 minute rest at 156° F. Add 17 qts sparge water to mash out. Vorleuf until wort clear, collect, and boil. Chill to 64° F, pitch yeast, and allow to free rise to 66° F. Hold at 66° F for duration of fermentation. Package with corn sugar to naturally carbonate to 1.8 volumes.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Divesh Lakhi of Cedar Rapids, IA, won a bronze medal in Category #14: American Porter & Stout with an American Stout during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Lakhi’s American Stout was chosen as a top three entry among 304 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
10 lb. Golden Promise
0.5 lb. White Wheat
0.5 lb. Flaked Barley
0.5 lb. Munich Malt
0.5 lb. Victory Malt
0.4375 lb. Crystal 60L
0.3125 lb. Crystal 120L
0.75 lb. Chocolate Malt
0.625 lb. Roasted Barley
0.125 lb. Black Patent Malt
HOPS
0.8 oz. Nugget pellet hops, 13.6% AA, @ 60 min
3.25 oz. East Kent Golding pellet hops, 4.4% AA, @ 10 min
YEAST
White Labs WLP001 California Ale, 2 packets
Additional Ingredients
1 Whirfloc table @ 15 min
Specifications:
Yield: 5.25 US gal
Original Gravity: 1.064
Final Gravity: 1.017
ABV: 6.17%
IBU: 51
SRM: 38.5
Efficiency: 73%
directions:
Directions:
Single infusion mash at 154° F for 60 minutes. Mash and Sparge, then boil for 60 minutes. After flameout, chill to 66° F, oxygenate and pitch in yeast. Ferment at 66-68° F. Let condition for two weeks after fermentation is complete. Carbonate to 2.2 vol. CO2.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Tyler Mangin of Fargo, ND, member of the Prairie Homebrewing Companions, won a bronze medal in Category #15: Imperial Stout during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Mangin’s Imperial Stout was chosen as a top three entry among 226 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS & ADJUNCTS
12.0 lb. (5.44 kg) Pale Malt, Maris Otter (Crisp)
2.0 lb. (907 g) Black Prinz (Briess)
2.0 lb. (907 g) Brown Malt (Crisp)
2.0 lb. (907 g) German Munich (Best)
2.0 lb. (907 g) Roasted Barley
16.0 oz. (454 g) Aromatic Malt (Dingemans)
16.0 oz. (454 g) Dark Munich (Weyerman)
16.0 oz. (454 g) Pale Chocolate (Crisp)
16.0 oz. (454 g) Vienna Malt (Weyermann)
8.0 oz. (227 g) Caramunich III (Weyermann)
8.0 oz. (227 g) Oats, Flaked
8.0 oz. (227 g) Special B Malt (Dingeman)
HOPS
1.6 oz. (45 g) Magnum, 13.2% a.a. @ 90 min
1.0 oz. (28 g) Sterling, 7.4% a.a. @ 30 min
2.0 oz. (57 g) Sterling, 8.1% a.a. @ 0 min
2.0 oz. (57 g) Fuggle, 4.5% a.a., dry hop 7 days
YEAST
Wyeast Labs 1335 British Ale II
Specifications:
Yield: 5.5 US gal (20.8 L)
Original Gravity: 1.1
Final Gravity: 1.025
ABV: 10%
IBU: 86
SRM: 86
directions:
Directions:
Two separate 1600 mL yeast starters with Wyeast 1335.  Allowed to settle and decanted each to 1L prior to pitching.  Brew in a bag full volume mash.  Direct fire step mash using only Base Malts to target Mash pH 5.3:  131 °F for 15 minutes.  144 °F for 50 minutes.  158 °F for 50 minutes.  Added all caramel and roast malts.  Heat to 168 °F mash out. Boiled for 90 minutes with hop additions at 90 minutes, 30 minutes and knockout.  Chill to 67° F and pitch yeast starters.  Ferment at 67 °F for 3 days.  Then rise 1 °F per day up to 72 °F.  Dry hop on day 7 for 7 days until kegging.  Force carbonation to 2.4 volumes.  Bottle from keg using Blichmann Beer Gun.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Mark Booth of New Market, MN, won a bronze medal in Category #16: American IPA during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Booth’s American IPA was chosen as a top three entry among 353 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
10 lb American - Pale 2-Row
1 lb German - Dark Munich
0.5 lb Flaked Oats
0.5 lb Flaked Wheat
HOPS
0.5 oz Amarillo Pellet, 8.6 a.a., First Wort (17.72 IBU)
1 oz Amarillo Pellet, 8.6 a.a., Boil, 10 min (11.68 IBU)
2 oz Amarillo Pellet, 8.6 a.a., Whirlpool at 180 °F, 0 min (7.5 IBU)
1 oz YCH - Citra LupuLN2 (Cryo) Lupulin Pellet, 25 a.a., Whirlpool at 180 °F, 0 min (10.89 IBU)
0.5 oz Amarillo Pellet, 8.6 a.a., Dry Hop at 67 °F
1 oz YCH - Citra LupuLN2 (Cryo) Lupulin Pellet, 25 a.a., Dry Hop at 67 °F
1 oz YCH - Simcoe LupuLN2 (Cryo) Lupulin Pellet, 23 a.a., Dry Hop at 67 °F
0.5 oz Amarillo Pellet, 8.6 a.a., Dry Hop at 70 °F
1 oz YCH - Citra LupuLN2 (Cryo) Lupulin Pellet, 25 a.a., Dry Hop at 70 °F
1 oz YCH - Simcoe LupuLN2 (Cryo) Lupulin Pellet, 23 a.a, Dry Hop at 70 °F
Specifications:
Yield: 5.5 US gal
Original Gravity: 1.056
Final Gravity: 1.01
ABV: 6.04%
IBU: 47
SRM: 4.79
Efficiency: 70%
directions:
Directions:
Crush grain, mash at 152 °F for 60 minutes. Target a pH of 5.2, they used lactic acid to adjust. Use distilled water and add minerals back in. Sparge. Boil for 60 minutes, cool to 70 °F, then add appropriate oxygen, pitch dry yeast and drop temp to 67 °F. First 2.5 oz dry hop additions at high krausen, second after fermentation is complete. Raise temp if needed to clean yeast flavors. Cold crash after 3-5 days of second dry hop charge. Burst carbonate and enjoy!

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Alex MacIntosh of Providence, RI, member of the Rhode Island Brewing Society (RIBS), won a bronze medal in Category #19: Strong UK Ale with an Old Ale during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. MacIntosh’s Old Ale was chosen as a top three entry among 248 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS & ADJUNCTS
18.0 lb. (8.16 kg) Maris Otter (Crisp)
12.0 oz. (340 g) Caramel Malt - 40L (Briess)
8.0 oz. (227 g) Honey Malt (Gambrinus)
8.0 oz. (227 g) Munich Malt
4.0 oz. (113 g) Chocolate Wheat (Weyermann)
4.0 oz. (113 g) Crystal Extra Dark - 120L (Crisp)
HOPS
2.0 oz. (57 g) Willamette, 4.4% a.a. @ 60 min
0.3 oz. (7 g) Magnum, 14.0% a.a. @ 60 min
YEAST
Giga Yeast GY044 Scotch Ale One
Specifications:
Yield: 6.1 US gal (23.1 L)
Original Gravity: 1.105
Final Gravity: 1.03
ABV: 10%
IBU: 32.7
SRM: 18.7
directions:
Directions:
Single mash infusion at 152 °F for 60 minutes.  Target pH of 5.4. Lauter then boil for 200 minutes.  Chill to 63 °F and pitch yeast (make a starter with appropriate cell count).  Once active fermentation begins, raise temp to 65 °F and keep there until fermentation is complete, about 2 weeks. Transfer to oak barrel (I used freshly dumped rum barrel, but spirit-soaked oak cubes would suffice).  Leave in barrel for 3 months (or until you are happy with the result). package, and store for long term aging. Over time, slight oxidative notes will mellow well with the oak and spirit character, creating an awesome old ale!

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
David Allen of Mill Creek, WA, member of the Greater Everett Brewers League, won a bronze medal in Category #20: Saisonduring the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Allen’s standard Saison was chosen as a top three entry among 253 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
10.25 lb. Dingemans Pilsner Malt
1.5 lb Castle Pale Malt
0.5 lb Rahr White Wheat Malt
0.25 Rahr 6-row Malt
HOPS
0.65 oz. Styrian Aurora pellets, 7.5% a.a., @45 minutes
0.25 oz. Loral pellets, 10.2% a.a., @ 15 minutes
0.5 oz. Styrian Celeia pellets, 3.7% a.a., @ 5 minutes
1 oz. Styrian Celeia pellets, 3.7% a.a., @ flameout
0.25 oz. Loral pellets,10.2% a.a, @ flameout
YEAST
Starter (stir plate) - 1 packet Wyeast 3724, 1 vial The Yeast Bay Saison II Blend
Additional Ingredients
Wyeast Yeast Nutrient Whirfloc
Specifications:
Yield: 5.5 US gal
Original Gravity: 1.048
Final Gravity: 1.006
ABV: 5.50%
IBU: 23
SRM: 8
directions:
Directions:
Single Infusion Mash at 148 °F. Pitch at 68 °F and hold fermentation at 70 °F until completion. I generally re-ferment in cork/cage Belgian bottles which will safely hold the carbonation level. Boil a pint of water with 6 oz of dextrose for 10 minutes; let cool. Blend with your beer and add 6 tbsp of yeast slurry harvested from the batch. Again, you want bottles that can hold the pressure. Otherwise, force carbonate to 3.5 volumes

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
John Groeger of Mechanicsville, MD, member of the Fredericksburg Brewing Insiders, won a bronze medal in Category #21: Belgian Ale with a Belgian Blond Ale during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Groeger’s Belgian Blond Ale was chosen as a top three entry among 231 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
13.25 lb. Belgian Pilsner malt
1 lb German Wheat
0.25 lb Aromatic malt
HOPS
1.8 oz Hallertauer, 3.4% aa @ 60 min
0.75 oz Teggnang 2.2% aa @ 10 min
YEAST
White labs WL 500 Monastery Ale Yeast, 2L starter
Additional Ingredients
0.75 lb cane sugar, primary
1/2 tsp White Labs yeast nutrient @ 10 min
1 tsp Irish moss @ 10 min
Specifications:
Yield: 5.5 US gal
Original Gravity: 1.065
Final Gravity: 1.01
ABV: 7.20%
IBU: 19.9
SRM: 5.1
Efficiency: 64%
directions:
Directions:
No sparge technique; Single infusion mash at 150 °F for 60 minutes. with 5.75 gallons of mash water (I use a recirculating mash technique on stove). Heat 4.5 gal sparge water to about 195 °F, add to mash tun, adjusting temp to 168 °F, circulate for 20 minutes. Drain to boil kettle. Boil for 90 minutes, adding hops, yeast nutrient, and Irish moss at prescribed times.  Chill to 63 °F, pitch yeast, allowing to rise to 65 °F. Ferment at 65 °F for two days, add sugar solution, allow tempt to rise to 72 °F. Ferment one week total, then transfer to secondary for 7 days. Force carbonate to 2.8 vol. CO2.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Jonas Geiss of Guarulhos, BRA, member of the Acerva Paulista homebrew club, won a bronze medal in Category #22: Strong Belgian Ale with a Belgian Dark Strong Ale during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Geiss’s Dark Strong Ale was chosen as a top three entry among 389 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
10kg Best Malz Pilsen
0.5kg Chateau Special B
0.45kg Best Munich dark
0.45kg Best Caramel aromatic
ADJUNCTS
0.45kg Candi  syrup,  D-180
30g Magnum hops 12% a.a @ 60 min
20g EKG 5% a.a @ 30 min
YEAST
White Labs WLP500 Trappist Ale,  2L  Starter
Additional Ingredients
1.0 Item Whirlfoc tablet, 10min
Adjust Zinc to 0.2 ppm
Specifications:
Yield: 25 L
Original Gravity: 24 P
Final Gravity: 10.8 P
ABV: 11.45%
IBU: 30.9
SRM: 24.7
Efficiency: 70%
directions:
Directions:
Target a water: grain ratio 3:1. Mash 62 ºC for 30 minutes, then raise temperature to 70 ºC  for more 30 minutes, sparge at 70 ºC. Boil 90 minutes. Chill the wort to 20 °C, add the yeast slurry, oxygen for 2 minutes at 5 L/minute flow by the fermenter tap. Ferment in conical fermenter. -20.5 ºC for 5 days; -23 ºC for more 5 days and then drain off the yeast from the conical fermenter -keep for more 28 days at -1 ºC – Forced carbonation, target 3 vols. Bottle and condition for 8 months at room temperature. ENJOY IT!

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Tom Morgan of Dayton, OH, member of the D.R.A.F.T. Homebrew Club, won a bronze medal in Category #23: European Sour Ale with a Gueuze during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Morgan’s Gueuze was chosen as a top three entry among 231 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
FERMENTABLES
8 lbs Best Malz Pilsen
4 lbs. unmalted wheat
1 oz. aged hops @ 60
4 batches of beer were blended
Yeast in the four different batches: East Coast Yeast 20 Bug County, East Coast Yeast 01 Bug Farm Yeast, dregs of Bruery Rueuze Yeast, dregs of Hanssens Oude Gueuze, and others.
Additional Info
One of the blended components was barrel-aged for two years in American oak
Specifications:
Yield: 6 US gal
Original Gravity: 1.056
Final Gravity: 1.002
ABV: 6.50%
Efficiency: 70%
directions:
Directions:
This recipe is 4 beers blended together. Beers were brewed in 2012, 2014, 2015, and 2017. Blended in December 2018. Mash @ 150 °F for  60 minutes. Batch-sparge @ 165 °F for 20 minutes. Boil for 70 minutes; add aged hops at 60 minutes. Chill to 70 °F, and pitch yeast (see ingredient list).  In 12 to 18 months, rack to 3 gallon carboys for bulk aging and future blending. This blend was: 2 gallons, April 2017; 2 gallons, September 2014; 1 gallon, March 2015; 1 gallon, November 2012.  Blended and bottled on December 31, 2018 with 8.5 oz. table sugar.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Zach Ahting of Walton, KY, member of the Cincinnati Malt Infusers, won a bronze medal in Category #24: Fruit Beer with a Berliner Weisse with Raspberries during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Ahting’s Berliner Weisse with Raspberries was chosen as a top three entry among 299 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
FERMENTABLES
3 lb. German Pilsner
1.5 lb. German Wheat Malt
6 lb. Raspberries
2 Goodbelly Plus Shot
2 Pills Renew Life Women's Care Ultimate Flora Probiotic
Omega Voss Kveik
Red Star Premier Blanc (bottle conditioning)
Additional Ingredients
1/2 dram Lorann's Raspberry flavoring
5mL St. Peter's Basilica Holy Water (no joke)
3 tablets of  Beano
2g coriander
1/8th tsp Wyeast Yeast nutrient
Specifications:
Yield: 3 US gal
Original Gravity: 1.045
Final Gravity: 1.004
ABV: 5.35%
SRM: 2.72
Efficiency: 75%
directions:
Directions:
Single infusion mash at 145 °F for 60 minutes. Target 5.2 pH. Boil for 15 minutes, add coriander at flameout. Chill to 100 °F, rack to carboy, add Goodbelly, probiotic pills and crushed beano. Hold at 100 °F for 1-2 days, taking care not to expose to oxygen.  Pitch yeast and ferment at 95 °F.  When primary fermentation has finished, blend raspberries with holy water and add to primary fermenter.  Ferment at room temperature until stable gravity has been reached. Add sufficient corn sugar and champagne yeast to carbonate to 2.8 volumes of CO2.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Lucio Botelho of Rio de Janeiro, BRA, member of the Acerva Brasil, won a bronze medal in Category #26: Smoke-Flavored Beer with a Smoked Wee Heavy during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Botelho’s Smoked Wee Heavy was chosen as a top three entry among 141 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS & ADJUNCTS
6.6 lb. (3.00 kg) Pilsen Agrária
4.4 lb. (2.00 kg) Pilsner/Lager Malt (Bairds)
4.4 lb. (2.00 kg) Viking Smoked Malt, Apple wood
4.4 lb. (2.00 kg) Viking Smoked Malt, beech wood
2.2 lb. (1000 g) Maris Otter (Crisp)
2.0 lb. (900 g) Chateau Crystal
14.1 oz. (400 g) Chateau Munich
14.1 oz. (400 g) Chateau Special B
12.3 oz. (350 g) Chateau Biscuit
10.6 oz. (300 g) Chateau Arome
5.3 oz. (150 g) Roasted Barley
7.1 oz. (200 g) Molasses
HOPS
1.0 oz. (27 g) Hallertau Magnum, 11.0% a.a. @ 60 min
0.8 oz. (22 g) Columbus (Tomahawk), 16.0% a.a. @ 60 min
0.7 oz. (20 g) Tettnang (Tettnang Tettnager), 4.0% a.a. @ 30 min
0.2 oz. (7 g) Styrian Golding (Savinja Golding), 5.0% a.a. @ 10 min
YEAST
DCL/Fermentis US-05 Safale American
Specifications:
Yield: 9.2 US gal (35 L)
Original Gravity: 1.084
Final Gravity: 1.015
ABV: 8.70%
IBU: 40
SRM: 23.5
directions:
Directions:
Use triple filtered tap water. Mash at 129 °F (54°C) with 9 gallons (34 L) of water for 10 minutes, 150 °F (66°C) for 55 minutes, 154 °F (68°C) for 20 minutes. Mash out at 168 °F (76 °C) for 10 minutes and sparge. Boil for 80 minutes to release DMS. Molasses added at end boil time.  Cool wort to 65 °F (18 °C), oxygenate and pitch yeast. Start fermentation at 65 °F (18 °C) for 5 days then increase temperature to 71 °F (22 °C) for 2 days. Decrease temperature 2 °C a day until reach 34 °F (1 °C) and let it rest for 2 weeks. Priming with demerara sugar 7g/l (0.25oz/qt). A period of cold conditioning for some months will improve it.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Chad Steinke of Denver, CO, member of the CO-Brew, won a bronze medal in Category #27: Wood-Aged Beer with a Russian Imperial Stout with lactose, coffee, aged in bourbon barrel during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Steinke’s Russian Imperial Stou was chosen as a top three entry among 310 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS & ADJUNCTS
14.7 lb. (6.69 kg) Maris Otter Pale
4.7 lb. (2.15 kg) CaraCrystal Wheat Malt
4.1 lb. (1.88 kg) Munich - Light 10L
3.5 lb. (1.59 kg) Caramel / Crystal 40L
1.7 lb. (794 g) Lactose (Milk Sugar)
1.5 lb. (680 g) Flaked Barley
1.5 lb. (680 g) Flaked Oats
12.0 oz. (340 g) Chocolate
8.0 oz. (227 g) Smoked Malt
HOPS
1.3 oz. (35 g) Columbus, 15.0% a.a. @ 60 min
3.0 oz. (85 g) East Kent Goldings, 5.1% a.a. @ 30 min
0.8 oz. (21 g) Columbus, 15.0% a.a. @ 15 min
YEAST
White Labs WLP075 hansen
ADDITIONAL ITEMS
Cocoa Nibs, Secondary
Coffee Bean (whole), Secondary
Specifications:
Yield: 6.5 US gal (24.6 L)
Original Gravity: 1.114
Final Gravity: 1.038
ABV: 10%
IBU: 68.7
SRM: 39.5
directions:
Directions:
Single infusion mash at 155 °F for 120 minutes. Add lactose last 20 minutes of boil. Set fermentation temp to 68 °F. Day 5 raise temp to 70 °F. After fermentation is complete rack beer into Kings Country Distillery barrel (sourced from Brooklyn, NY). After barrel character is achieved (approx 2 months for 5 gallons), rack beer into keg with toasted cacao nibs. Taste daily until desired flavor is achieved. Remove cacao once flavor is achieved. Add 4 oz of favorite coffee beans to keg. Taste daily until desired flavor is achieved. Remove coffee from beer once flavor is achieved. Enjoy a home brew!

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Ryan Smalley of Lexington, KY, member of the BOCK (Brewers of Central Kentucky), won a bronze medal in Category #28: American Wild Ale with a dry hopped pale ale with Brettanomyces during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Smalley’s Dry hopped pale ale with brett was chosen as a top three entry among 334 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS & ADJUNCTS
8.0 oz. (227 g) Rice Hulls
13.0 lb. (5.90 kg) Pilsen (Dingemans)
1.3 lb. (595 g) Wheat, Flaked
13.0 oz. (369 g) BEST Spelt Malt (BESTMALZ)
12.0 oz. (340 g) Aromatic Malt
12.0 oz. (340 g) Munich I (Weyermann)
HOPS
0.9 oz. (26 g) Mosaic (HBC 369), 13.5% a.a. @ 30 min
0.8 oz. (22 g) Citra, 12.0% a.a. @ 5 min
0.7 oz. (20 g) Mosaic (HBC 369), 13.5% a.a. @ 5 min
1.1 oz. (32 g) Citra, 12.0% a.a., dry hop
0.9 oz. (26 g) Mosaic (HBC 369), 14.3% a.a., dry hop
0.6 oz. (18 g) Simcoe, 13.0% a.a., dry hop
0.5 oz. (14 g) Amarillo, 9.2% a.a., dry hop
YEAST
ECY08 Saison Brasserie Blend, no starter
ECY35 (Brettanomyces Bruxellensis).
ADDITIONAL ITEMS
1 Whirlfloc Tablet, Boil 15 min
1 Wort Chiller, Boil 15 min
Specifications:
Yield: 7.7 US gal (29.1 L)
Original Gravity: 1.059
Final Gravity: 1
ABV: 5.60%
IBU: 33.9
SRM: 5.4
directions:
Directions:
Single infusion mash at 153 °F for 60 minutes. Target 5.3 pH. Lauter then boil for 60 minutes. Chill to 72 °F and pitch yeast (ECY08 Saison Brasserie Blend no starter). Ferment at 72 °F. On day 14, pitch ECY35 (Brettanomyces Bruxellensis). Allow to age on Brettanomyces for 60 days at room temperature. Pitch dry hops 5 days before bottling. Bottle carbonate with EC1118 to 3.0 vol. CO2

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Karl King of Colleyville, TX, member of the Cap and Hare Homebrew Club, won a bronze medal in Category #29: Specialty Beer with a Wheat Eisbock during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. King’s Wheat Eisbock was chosen as a top three entry among 215 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
8 lb. Wheat malt
5.5 lb. Vienna malt
4.5 lb. Pilsner malt
1.25 lb. Munich malt
0.56 lb. CaraVienne malt
0.56 lb. Crystal 20L
0.20 lb. Chocolate malt
HOPS
0.45 oz. Magnum, 13.3% a.a. @ 60 min
YEAST
1 sachet Fermentis SafAle T-58
Specifications:
Yield: 4 US gal
Original Gravity: 1.12
Final Gravity: 1.04
ABV: 11.20%
IBU: 27
SRM: 19.4
Efficiency: 70%
directions:
Directions:
Protein rest at 131 °F for 20 minutes. Mash at 154 °F for 60 minutes. Boil for 120 minutes and at 60 minutes before flameout add hops. Chill to 67 °F and pitch yeast. Ferment at 68 °F. Cold crash when fully attenuated. Force carbonate to 2.6 vol. CO2.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Richard Romanko of East Pittsburgh, PA, member of the Three Rivers Underground Brewers, won a silver medal in Category #1: Pale American Beer with a Cream Ale during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Romanko’s Cream Ale was chosen as the runner-up entry among 330 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
7 lb. Heidleberg Malt  1.5 SRM
6 lb. Pale Malt (2row) 2.0 SRM
4 lb. flaked corn 1.3 SRM
1 lb. flaked barley 1.7 SRM
5 oz. Acid Malt  3.0 SRM
HOPS
0.6 oz. Sterling, 11.6 a.a., @ 60 minutes
YEAST
3 vials White Labs Cream Ale Blend (WLP080)
ADDITIONAL INGREDIENTS
1 Whirlflock tablet @ 10 minutes
Water Treatment
14.92 gallons of RO water treated with 7.5 grams of Gypsum and 4.5 grams of Calcium Chloride
Target mash/sparge PH of 5.35 Ca 59, Sulfate 74, Chloride 51
Specifications:
Yield: 11 US gal (41.6 L)
Original Gravity: 1.045
Final Gravity: 1.004
ABV: 5.38%
IBU: 12.7
SRM: 2.9
Efficiency: 76.70%
directions:
Directions:
Batch Sparge at 145° F for 75 minutes. Boil for 60 minutes. Add Whirlflock at 10 minutes. Cool to 60° F and add yeast and oxygen. Crash when fermentation is complete and try to lager for a couple of weeks prior to serving.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Metts Potter of Browns Summit, NC, member of the Battleground Brewers Guild, the winning club of the 2019 Gambrinus Club Award, won a silver medal in Category #2: Pale European Beer with a Munich Helles during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Potter’s Munich Helles was chosen as the runner-up entry among 394 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
4 lb. Weyermann Pilsner Malt
4 lb. Weyermann Barke Pilsner Malt
1 lb. Bestmalz Munich Malt
1.25 lb. Bestmalz Vienna Malt
4 oz. Weyermann Carafoam malt
2 oz. Weyermann Carahell malt
HOPS
1 oz. Tettnang, 3.2% a.a., first wort hop
1 oz. Tettnang, 3.2% a.a. @ 15 min
YEAST
WLP 838, 200 mL of thick slurry from fresh yeast cake
Water Treatment
3.2 g CaCl, 60 mL of 10% phosphoric acid into 12 gallons of water (bulk water treatment for entire batch)
Specifications:
Yield: 5.5 US gal (20.8 L)
Original Gravity: 1.05
Final Gravity: 1.01
ABV: 5.20%
IBU: 18
SRM: 4.5
Efficiency: 71
directions:
Directions:
Mash at 151°F for 60 minutes at 5.3 pH. Heat to 170°F to mashout via HERMS, then fly sparge to collect 8.75 gallons of wort. Boil at low intensity for 90 minutes then chill to 70°F with ground water. Rack to fermenter, then chill to 45°F in chest freezer over 2-3 hrs.  Rack to second fermenter, leaving behind all settled trub. Oxygenate with pure oxygen for 3 minutes, then pitch yeast slurry. Ferment at 50°F for 5 days or until fermentation starts to slow, then raise temp by 5°F daily to 70°F. Leave at 70°F for 5 days, then keg, then cold crash while force carbonating to 2.5 vol CO2. Clarify with gelatin.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Jerry Mitchell of O'Fallon, MO, member of the Garage Brewers Society, won a silver medal in Category #3: Pilsner with a German Pils during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Mitchell’s German Pils was chosen as the runner-up entry among 286 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS & ADJUNCTS
8.7 lb. (3.97 kg) Pilsner (Weyermann)
8.0 oz. (227 g) Carafoam (Weyermann)
2.0 oz. (57 g) Acid Malt
2.0 oz. (57 g) Melanoiden Malt
HOPS
0.8 oz. (23 g) Perle, 7.2% a.a. @ 60 min
0.5 oz. (13 g) Hallertau Tradition, 5.9% a.a. @ 30 min
0.5 oz. (13 g) Select Spalt, 4.6% a.a. @ 30 min
0.4 oz. (11 g) Hallertau Tradition, 5.9% a.a. @ 5 min
0.4 oz. (11 g) Select Spalt, 4.6% a.a. @ 5 min
YEAST
Wyeast Labs 2308 Munich Lager
ADDITIONAL ITEMS
0.1 oz. (4 g) Calcium Chloride, Mash 60.0 min
0.1 oz. (4 g) Gypsum (Calcium Sulfate), Mash 60.0 min
1 Whirlfloc Tablet, Boil 15.0 min
Yeast Nutrient, Boil 15.0 min
Specifications:
Yield: 5.7 US gal (21.8 L)
Original Gravity: 1.049
Final Gravity: 1.009
ABV: 4.80%
IBU: 35.8
SRM: 3.2
Efficiency: 77%
directions:
Directions:
Added 3.5 grams each of Calcium Chloride and Gypsum to 12 gallons of RO water. Single infusion mash at 148° F for 60 mins.  Lauter then boil for 90 minutes.  Chill to 45° F and pitch yeast starter.  Allow to free rise to 50° F.  Hold at 50° F for 4 days.  Allow to rise to 60° F and hold for a week. Keg, add CO2 at 8 psi and then drop 5° F every 12 hours until temperature reaches 33° F.  Increase CO2 pressure to 13 lbs. Hold at this temp for 4 weeks.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Tim Gerbracht of Vienna, VA, member of GRiST, won a silver medal in Category #4: Amber European Beer with a Vienna Lager during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Gerbracht’s Vienna Lager was chosen as the runner-up entry among 365 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
8.5 lb. Avangard Vienna Malt
3 lb. Weyermann Barke Pilsner Malt
0.25 lb. Weyermann Melanoidin Malt
1.5 oz. Briess Midnight Wheat (10 min remaining in 60 min mash)
HOPS
0.5 oz. Magnum (12.5AA) @ 60 min
0.5 oz. Czech Saaz (3.5AA) @ 15 min
YEAST
Imperial Global, 2nd Generation slurry (1.5million cells/ml/degree Plato equivalent)
Additional Ingredients
Whirlfloc @ 15 min
Wyeast Nutrient @10 min
Specifications:
Yield: 5.5 US gal (20.8 L)
Original Gravity: 1.048
Final Gravity: 1.013
ABV: 4.70%
IBU: 22
SRM: 9
Efficiency: 64
directions:
Directions:
Single Infusion mash @ 154° F for 60 m. Add Midnight Wheat with 10 minutes remaining for color adjustment with scant roast impression. Calculate mash pH with base malts only. Target Mash pH- 5.3. BIAB, full volume mash technique. Chill wort to 50° F. Aerate through shaking or oxygen. Pitch slurry or equivalent fresh generation yeast. Hold initial fermentation temperature at 50° F for five days. Ramp up 5° F every 12 hours to 65° F thereafter. Hold at 65° F for five days, taste fermented beer to confirm terminal attenuation and desired flavor profile. Crash beer to 34° F, decreasing 5° F every 12 hours. Hold at  34° F for five days.  Rack chilled beer to keg, add heated gelatin solution (1 tsp finings/1 cup water @ 150° F) on top of racked beer.  Let settle for 12 hours, then burst carbonate at 30 psi for 36 hours. Drop serving pressure to 10 psi thereafter.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Hank Keller of Cypress, TX, member of the Foam Rangers, won a silver medal in Category #6: Strong European Lager with a Dark Dopplebock during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Keller’s Doppelbock was chosen as the runner-up entry among 269 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
11 lb. Dark Munich malt
6 lb. Pilsner malt
2 lb. Caramunich malt
0.5 lb. Melanoidin malt
HOPS
0.83 oz. Magnum Pellets, 12.4 a.a. @ 60 min
YEAST
Wyeast 2296 / Bavarian Lager, 2000 ml starter.
Additional Ingredients
1 tsp. Irish Moss @ 15 min
Specifications:
Yield: 6 US gal (22.7 L)
Original Gravity: 1.11
Final Gravity: 1.032
ABV: 10.20%
IBU: 18
Efficiency: 70
directions:
Directions:
For the sparge water, I used about a 50/50 mix of RO water with my filtered water. Single infusion mash at 154° F. Pull first 2 gallons of wort into small kettle and boil down over 2 hours to get about 1/2 gallon. In main pot, collect about 7 gallons of wort, and boil down to 5 gallons. Combine both parts into main kettle and boil for 10 minutes. Chill wort down to 52° F, oxygenate well, and pitch yeast starter. Ferment at 50-52° F for approximately 2 weeks, then raise temperature for a diacetyl rest. After 3 days, slowly lower temperature down to 40° F and keg.

description:

Rupert’s Weizenbock was chosen as the runner-up entry among 200 entries in the category.
ingredients:

White Labs WLP300 Hefeweizen Ale
ADDITIONAL ITEMS

Final Gravity: 1.015

IBU: 24.4
SRM: 23
directions:
Directions:
Water Treatment: 8.50 gal RO Water Water  3.03 g Gypsum (Calcium Sulfate) (Mash)  2.33 g Epsom Salt (MgSO4) (Mash) 1.86 g Calcium Chloride (Mash) Temperature Mash, 5 Step, Medium Body 1 – Acid Rest: Add 33.56 qt of water and heat to 95° F over 0 min 95° F 10 min. 2 – Protein Rest 1: Heat to 113° F over 15 min and hold for 10 min. 3 – Protein Rest 2: Heat to 135° F over 15 min 135° F 15 min. 4 – Saccharification Step 1: Heat to 145° F over 15 min 145° F 20 min. 5 – Saccharification Step 2: Heat to 154° F over 15 min 154° F 20 min. Mash Out Heat to 168° F over 15 min 168° F 10 min.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!

ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
5.75 lb. Pilsen malt
0.625 lb. Carafoam malt
1.875 lb. Wheat Malt
HOPS
0.75 oz. Saaz, 2.8% A.A @ 60 min
0.4 oz. Citra, 13.8% A.A @ 20 min
0.75 oz. Mandarina Bavaria, 9.6 A.A @ 5 min
0.4 oz. Mosaic, 12.5 A.A @ whirlpool 20 min
YEAST
Escarpment Labs Ontario Farmhouse Ale Blend
Specifications:
Yield: 5 US gal (18.9 L)
Original Gravity: 1.049
Final Gravity: 1.007
ABV: 5.50%
IBU: 27
SRM: 3.2
Efficiency: 72%
directions:
Directions:
Mash unmalted wheat at 135-140° F for 30-45 min then add the remaining malt for a two step mash with the first one at 142° F for 30 minutes and 156° F for 30 minutes. Target  5.4 for pH.  Lauter then boil for 60 minutes. After flameout, add whirlpool hops and allow 20 minutes of contact time. Chill to 70° F and pitch yeast starter. Ferment between 71-80° F depending on preference and techniques available. Ferment until terminal gravity is reached.

description:
The following beer recipe is featured in the September/October 2019 issue of Zymurgy magazine. Access this issue along with the archives with Zymurgy Online!
Mark Peterson of Queen Creek, AZ, member of the Arizona Society of Homebrewers, the winning club of the 2019 NHC Homebrew Club Award, and winner of the 2019 Homebrewer of the Year and Ninkasi Awards, won a silver medal in Category #9: Scottish & Irish Ale with a Scottish Heavy during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Peterson’s Scottish Heavy was chosen as the runner-up entry among 222 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS
11 lb. Pale Malt 2 row (UK 3.0 SRM)
1.5 lb. Munich Malt (9.0 SRM)
1 lb. Caramel/Crystal Malt 60L (60SRM)

3.2 oz. Roasted Barley (Crisp) (695 SRM)

1 oz. Fuggles (4.5%) @ 60 min
0.5 oz. Fuggles (4.5%) @ 15 min

2 pkg of Scottish Ale (Wyeast Labs #1728) and 2 L starter add yeast nutrients
Specifications:
Yield: 5 US gal (18.9 L)
Original Gravity: 1.08
Final Gravity: 1.023
ABV: 8.90%
IBU: 22
SRM: 18
Efficiency: 78%
directions:
Directions:
Mash 4.5 gallons of water at 163.5° F want mash to be at 150° F let it sit for 60 minutes  Drain 1.5 gallons of wort to caramelize reduce down to 0.5 gallon by boiling. Go back to mash and sparge with 4 gallons of water, add 0.5 gallon of caramelized wort with the sparge wort for 7.5 gallons of wort. Boil for 80 minutes and add hops per time specified. Cool down to 55° F, raise to 59° F pitch yeast. Maintain primary at 59°  F for 8 days. Secondary at 59° F for 14 days, raise to 65° F for 3 days, keg and age. Force carbonate to 2.4 vol. CO2.

1.8 lb. (834 g) Pale Malt (2 Row) UK

7.2 oz. (203 g) Aromatic Malt
7.2 oz. (203 g) Caraamber (Weyermann)

directions:
Directions:
Acidify sparge water to ph 5.6 with lactic acid. Single infusion mash at 156° F, target ph of 5.2 to 5.5. Boil for 60 mins. Chill to 195° F and add whirlpool hops. Recirculate for 15 mins. Chill to 62° F, then oxygenate with pure oxygen for 20 seconds and pitch 2L yeast starter. Ferment in mid 60° F range until fully attenuated. Carbonate to about 2.5 vol CO2.

ingredients:

ABV: 5.10%
IBU: 50
SRM: 3.82
Efficiency: 70
directions:
Directions:
Single-infusion mash at 152° F for 60 minutes. Batch Sparge at 168° F to collect 4.5 gallons of wort. Boil for 60 minutes. After flameout, chill to 72° F and pitch yeast starter. Ferment at 72-74° F for 5-8 days, once fermentation slows, raise temperature to 76-78° F for 2 days for diacetyl rest. Drop temperature to 68-70° F and add dry hops for 3-4 days. Once fully attenuated, cold crash and add gelatin to clarify. Target 2.8 vol. CO2. with priming sugar for bottling or force carbonate for kegging.

ingredients:

Wyeast Labs 1968 London ESB Ale
ADDITIONAL ITEMS

directions:
Directions:
Add mineral additions to both strike and sparge water target a mash PH of 5.2. Single Infusion mash @ 152° F for 60 minutes. Raise RIMS temperature to 170° F for 15 minutes for mashout. Fly sparge with 170° F.  Boil for 15 minutes to facilitate hop break, then add hops. Boil 60 minutes (75 mins total). Chill to 66° F, pitch 2L yeast starter.  On day 3 free rise fermentation temps to 72° F and hold until fermentation is complete. Cold crash, flush keg with CO2, and keg beer.  Force carb to 1.5 vols.

description:

Andrew Johnson of Salem, OR, member of the Capitol Brewers, won a silver medal in Category #21: Belgian Ale with a Belgian Pale Ale during the 2019 National Homebrew Competition Final Round in Providence, RI. Johnson’s Belgian Pale Ale was chosen as the runner-up entry among 231 entries in the category.
ingredients:
Ingredients:
MALTS & ADJUNCTS
9.0 oz. (255 g) Aromatic
7.0 oz. (198 g) Flaked Oats
7.0 lb. (3.18 kg) Pilsner
12.0 oz. (340 g) CaraVienne
6.0 oz. (170 g) CaraMunich II
2.3 oz. (65 g) Carapils (Dextrine Malt)
2.3 oz. (65 g) Red Wheat
HOPS
0.8 oz. (21 g) Saaz, 5.1% a.a. @ 60 min
0.7 oz. (20 g) Saaz, 5.1% a.a. @ 20 min
0.4 oz. (11 g) Saaz, 5.1% a.a. @ 0 min
